page.title: 07The Knoll
page.content: The Knoll is approximately 500 years old and is in Marsh Green(square 9), which was originally a settlement in Saxon times.The house is made of cob which is a mixture of earth, stone and straw.It was first made as four cottages, then they were converted into two houses.After the First World War it was changed to one house.Joined to the house is a Smithy which was built for farm labourers. Separating the house and the road there is an orchard.At the bottom of the drive there is a store which is at least 100 years old and very rare.In the kitchen there is an iron fire which is about 200 years old and is thought to have been made in France or Belgium.In the lounge there are some alcoves which were put there in Queen Anne's reign.
